tool.name: create_consite

param.name: in_SBB
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class representing Site Building Blocks. These can be either original SBBs or SBBs expanded to encompass additional core habitat area, but current practice is to use the latter type.

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class representing Procedural Features. Every SBB must have a corresponding PF for the automation process to function correctly.

param.name: joinFld
param.dialogReference: The name of the field containing the unique ID linking SBBs to their corresponding PFs. The field name must be the same for both layers.

param.name: in_ConSites
param.dialogReference: Feature layer or feature class representing current Conservation Sites (as exported from Biotics). This is used as a template to create the new output Conservation Sites.

param.name: in_Hydro
param.dialogReference:
Input feature layer or feature class representing hydrographic features: ponds, lakes, and rivers.

  • This layer MUST include a field called "Hydro", which is set to the value if the feature should be used for Conservation Site delineation, and 0 or null otherwise.

param.name: in_TranSurf
param.dialogReference:
Input feature layer(s) or feature class(es) representating transportation surfaces (buffered centerlines).

  • You may input separate layers for roads and rails, or a single layer combining the two

  • The transportation layers MUST include a field called "nhIgnore", which is set to the value 1 if it should be ignored for the purpose of Conservation Site delineation, and 0 or null otherwise.

param.name: in_Exclude
param.dialogReference: Feature layer or feature class representing manually delineated "exclusion features", i.e., areas that should definitely be entirely excluded from Conservation Sites.

param.name: out_ConSites
param.dialogReference: Output feature class containing updated Conservation Sites.

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

param.name: brank
param.displayname: Calculate biodiversity ranks for output sites?
param.dialogReference: Whether to calculate a Biodiversity Significance Rank (B-rank) for output sites, using an automated procedure summarizing Procedural Features associated with the site. A default search distance of 15 meters is used to associate procedural features with sites.

tool.summary: Delineates Natural Heritage Conservation sites from Procedural Features (PFs), Site Building Blocks (SBBs), and modification features including road, rail, hydro, and manually-delineated exclusion features.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Delineates Natural Heritage Conservation sites from Procedural Features (PFs), Site Building Blocks (SBBs), and modification features including road, rail, and hydro surfaces as well as manually delineated exclusion features.
